meanings.definition: The rank or dignity of a thane.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, thaneship was a position of honor and respect.
meanings.sent2: The thaneship was passed down through generations in the noble family.
meanings.sent3: The young boy pretended to have thaneship over his toys, declaring himself king of the playroom.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the grace and authority befitting her thaneship.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming crown symbolized the thaneship of the ruler, shining brightly in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The office or jurisdiction of a thane.
meanings.sent1: The thaneship was responsible for maintaining order in the village.
meanings.sent2: The thaneship oversaw the distribution of resources to the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The cat humorously claimed thaneship over the household, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: His thaneship extended to every corner of the land, ensuring justice prevailed.
meanings.sent5: The thaneship's seal marked official documents, signifying authority and power.
